records.title: Encounter Group: Find The Answers To Life's Questions
records.text: The Encounter Group - Find Strength in Community – Join Our Self-Help Group in Boston Feeling stuck? Overwhelmed? You're not alone—and you don't have to face it alone either. Our Boston-based self-help group offers a safe, supportive space for individuals seeking growth, connection, and a fresh perspective on life's challenges. Whether you're navigating stress, life transitions, or simply looking to build resilience, our weekly gatherings provide encouragement, tools, and camaraderie. Come as you are—no judgment, no pressure. When: Every Tuesday evening Where: Community Room, Back Bay Wellness Center, Boston, MA Time: 6:30 PM – 8:00 PM Cost: Free (donations welcome). Anonymity guaranteed.

records.title: NBC News Archive 1995: New York Gas Explosion
records.text: By Carla Jiménez, Staff Reporter A thunderous explosion ripped through the early morning calm in Lower Manhattan yesterday, reducing the historic Macallister Building to rubble and sending a column of smoke and dust billowing into the sky. Authorities believe a natural gas leak was the likely cause. The blast occurred at approximately 4:38 a.m. Sunday morning. Witnesses as far as Canal Street reported being jolted awake by the explosion, which shattered windows and triggered car alarms for blocks around. Fire crews arrived within minutes to find the five-story brownstone completely collapsed, with flames licking at the twisted wreckage. “It was like an earthquake, and then a bomb went off,” said Kenneth Walters, 47, who lives in a building across the street. “I looked out the window and the Macallister was just... gone.” Twelve Missing, Including Artist-in-Residence At least twelve residents are unaccounted for and presumed dead, according to the FDNY. Among them is local artist Abigail Wright, 29, known in the downtown art scene for her surrealist oil paintings and mixed-media installations. Wright reportedly lived on the fifth floor and had not been seen in several days. “It’s a tragedy,” said Battalion Chief Robert Meeker. “We’ve got crews working around the clock to recover remains and investigate what happened. The scene is unstable, so it’s slow going.” Neighbors and former tenants described the Macallister Building as a “bohemian warren” of creatives and eccentric professionals, many of whom had lived there for years. The building, originally constructed in 1897, had a checkered history, including rumors of structural issues, haphazard renovations, and a long-abandoned basement level reportedly sealed in the 1970s. Preliminary Cause: Gas Leak According to Con Edison spokesperson Jamie Gertz, early evidence points to a gas leak originating from the basement utility lines. “We’re working with the FDNY and Department of Buildings to confirm the source,” Gertz said. “At this point, there’s no indication of foul play.” However, building records obtained by The Chronicle reveal multiple code violations filed in the past five years, including complaints about strange odors, faulty wiring, and illegal sub-partitions on the upper floors. City officials have ordered a full safety review of similar pre-war buildings in the area.

records.title: Ars Goetia Online
records.text: Whatever you can do, or dream you can do, begin it. Boldness has genius, power, and magic in it! The Preliminary Invocation to Primeumaton Primeumaton is Greek for “Thou Who Art the First and Last.” The preliminary invocation prays for the protection of angels and Yahweh in the dangerous work of compelling demonic powers under their command. The invocation begins with elaborate ceremonial preparations involving a sword, vessels for divination and conjuration, wax figures, scrolls written in blood, a ring, a ceremonial staff, special clothing, a garland, and careful timing according to arcane rules of astrology. Consult your grimoires for the most efficacious preparations. Draw a Solomonic Triangle marked with the words “ANAPHAXETON, ANAPHANETON, PRIMEUMATON” in a protective circle, in an isolated, enclosed area. Now, announce the names of the 72 demons subject to command: Aamon Agares Aim Alocer Amdusias Andras Andrealphus Andromalius Asmoday Astaroth Avnas Bael Balam Barbatos Bathin Beleth Belial Berith Bifrons Botis Buer Buné Camio Crocell Dantalion Decarabia Eligos Flauros Focalor Foras Forneus Furcas Furfur Gaap Glasya Gremory Guison Haagenti Ipos Kimaris Lejare Malphas Malthus Marbas Morax Murmur Naberius Orabas Orais Ose Paimon Phenex Purson Raum Ronové Sabnock Saleos Samigina Seere Shax Sitri Stolas Valac Valefar Vapula Vassago Vepar Vinea Vual Zagan Zepar Inscribe the seal of the particular demon you wish to contact. After the ritual is complete, the demon shall make itself known.
